body.name: Ring Smart Lighting – Spotlight, Battery-Powered, Outdoor Motion-Sensor Security Light, White (Bridge required)
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 20. Order within 14 hrs 15 mins
features: A battery-powered spotlight that shines 400 Lumens of brightness on driveways and other areas when motion is detected.
Ring Bridge, Ring Alarm Pro, Echo (4th Gen) or Echo Show 10 (3rd Gen) required to enable smart features, such as mobile notifications and customizable settings.
Add this to any Ring Smart Lighting Starter Kit with Ring Bridge so you can get notifications, customize settings, and connect to other Ring devices - all from the Ring app.

With the Echo (4th Gen), Echo Show 10 (3rd Gen), or Ring Bridge, you can connect this light with other Ring Smart Lights, Ring doorbells or cameras, and select Alexa-enabled devices to create a fully connected home security system.
Spotlight installs in minutes with a wire-free design and included toolkit to illuminate your driveway, patio, or yard.

productInformation.name: Motion Detection
productInformation.value: Adjustable motion detection. Up to 120° field of view. Detection angle dependent on distance from unit. 30' detection range.

productInformation.name: Approximate Battery Life
productInformation.value: 1 year under normal use (8-10 light activations a day, 30 second duration). Battery life is dependent on device settings, usage, and other factors. Brightness may decrease as battery life is depleted.

productInformation.name: Box Includes
productInformation.value: Ring Spotlight, Installation Tools & Screws, User Manual, Security Sticker

productInformation.name: Setup Requirements
productInformation.value: Mount to most surfaces with included screws. Power drill and bits not included. Ring Bridge required for smart controls on the Ring app and to connect with other Ring products (sold separately).

productInformation.name: Warranty and service
productInformation.value: 1-year limited warranty . Use of Ring Smart Lighting is subject to the terms found here.

productInformation.name: Support
productInformation.value: Click here to view more information on the Ring Smart Lighting support page.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works as designed plus great customer support
reviews.reviewText: I’ve had 5 of these for roughly 2 years. They’re ok but they work best if you have a group of them. One single light isn’t enough to light much up. But, I use mine in conjunction with my Ring spotlight and floodlight cams. I have them setup so that the spotlights in a certain proximity of my cameras light up when the camera does. I have two of these in my front yard, and 3 in the back. My yard isn’t huge, maybe 1500sq feet front and 3500 back. The yards are not totally lit. But for the price they’re ok. I don’t have the lights themselves turn on when motion is detected, only when my cameras detect motion as mentioned previously. With the lights turning themselves on when motion is detected they were coming on a lot, like every 5 minutes on a windy day. But I do like these lights. They can be adjusted to point at almost any angle, they’re not huge, and not terrible to look at.I don’t see if the description mentions any waterproof specs, but I did just go to change the batteries in one of them, and water came pouring out when I pulled out the battery compartment. Which is what got me to write the review. It was fully closed when I opened it. It wasn’t obvious how water got in. I’ll have to take a closer look. But because of that, going to have to lower my opinion of these lights from what would have probably been a 4 star rating down to a 2. If I can figure out if this was caused by user error or age (I never expected these to last forever) I’ll bump the rating back up.Edit 1 - 10/21/2023Ring saw this review, contacted me to troubleshoot the issue, and then sent me a replacement light. Considering this is one of 5 lights and the others work fine, I’m updating to 5 stars. Was going to stop at 4 but these things aren’t too pricey so I’m going to be generous and say they work exactly as designed. And I have them on my Christmas list so I can add more to my yard. I want my yard to light up like the Griswolds house at Christmas if anyone approaches my house at night. You know, for their safety.Thank you for coming to my Ted talk.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very Easy to Install and Connect to Alexa
reviews.reviewText: I have purchased a number of Beams MB360XT and wish I knew about these Ring Spotlights before I did. The price is a bit more than double the Beams MB360XT, but having the ability to integrate into my Smarthome is well worth the extra cost. Also, the Ring Spotlights are twice as bright. I am not able to use Arlo cameras as motion sensors to activate the lights. One of the complaints with the Beams MB360XT is that there is not a way to change the duration and it is quite short. With the Ring Spotlights, i can set the duration within the Ring App or an Alexa routine. Also, I purchased a two pack of the Ring Spotlights that included the Ring Bridge. I did not use the Bridge and I don't see a reason to. If I did not have Alexa's with Zigbee built in, I may have needed the Bridge. I have a feeling I will be buying a few more of these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is very good, however, it does have limited range

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 3, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great light for dark corners in your yard.
reviews.reviewText: Used two of these lights to supplement ring cameras and light up walkways not covered by other lighting. First I was worried using 4 D batteries would result in poor lighting, lousy performance and limited battery life. Not so.While not bright as some lights, these babies really shed light on dark areas. The motion activation is great and the Ring App notifies you when motion is detected. Despite frequent activations and constant movement monitoring, even after 2 months both lights still show 100% battery charge. Very impressive.I have been impressed with the Ring product line for years. These spotlights are a great addition to that line and well worth your consideration.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I love anything Ring!
reviews.reviewText: These are great motion lights. I love them and they are part of my home security system. They are battery which is what I wanted. No wires to run and easy installation.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewText: If you have any ring camera these spotlights are a must if you're looking for that extra security. But not only that, I have a big yard and my dog is visible throughout the yard. And having a dog that's scared of the dark gives her that extra confidence. It's a great piece of mind all the way around!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars nice lights... if you get ones that work
reviews.reviewText: I ordered the ring spotlight 2 pack with bridge and neither of the lights would connect to the bridge. I spent an hour on the phone with ring customer service only for them to come to the final determination that the spotlights were defective and I should return them. Amazon shipped me two new lights and both connected and work just fine. I've read other reviews that others have had similar issues. You would think that Ring would be able to figure out the issue and fix it. If you get working lights the set up process is actually pretty easy. Installation of the lights is easy as well.Pros:*If you get working lights it is easy to download the Ring app and follow the on screen instructions to set these up..*You can create groups so if you have more than one light they will both activate at the same time.*at a month in to using them the battery life still appears to be strong. I live in Minnesota and it's winter. So far the cold hasn't zapped the batteries.*installing on a wall/building is easy with the provided mounting screws.*Easy to adjust angle of the light after it's installed.Cons:*These spotlights feel like they are very cheaply made.*They seem unnecessarily bulky primarily due to the need to use 4 D cell batteries to power them.*Once the light turns on the brightness seems to fluctuate slowly. Almost like a slow flicker of the light.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My rental house doesn't have a back porch, or an electrical outlet to plug any lights in. So I needed something either rechargeable or battery operated. This works fantastic. As soon as I come out my backdoor, it flips on, and stay on until I get down my stairs and across my yard. (Usually taking my dogs out and it's so dark). The only issue I had was trying to screw it in, the plastic guide where the screws go...makes it really hard to maneuver. I struggled getting those screws in, so it's 1/2 hanging. Hope it stays up there.
